faq.answerWhatIsEsim: An eSIM is a digital SIM that lets you use a cellular plan without a physical SIM card. You can install it by scanning a QR code or through your carrier's app.
faq.howToInstall: How do I install my eSIM?
faq.answerHowToInstall: After purchase, you'll receive an email with a QR code and step-by-step instructions. On iPhone: Settings > Cellular > Add Cellular Plan > Scan QR code. On Android: Settings > Network & Internet > SIMs > Add eSIM.
faq.whenToActivate: When should I activate my eSIM?
faq.answerWhenToActivate: Activate when you arrive at your destination. Some plans allow activation before travel; check the plan details. Turning on the eSIM line and selecting it for data completes activation.
faq.answerRefundPolicy: Unused eSIMs can be refunded within 14 days of purchase. Once installed or activated, plans are non-refundable. See our Refund Policy for full details.
faq.coverage: How is coverage in my destination?
faq.answerCoverage: We partner with local operators in each country. Coverage is typically strong in urban areas; rural coverage may vary. Check the plan page for operator and network info.
faq.answerCompatibleDevices: Most recent iPhones (XS and later) and many Android phones (Pixel, Samsung Galaxy S20+, etc.) support eSIM. See our Compatible devices page for a full list.
